posts.post_content:
The positive side of this card:  
- Flavor text fits very well with the art.  
  
A few negative points:  
- CMC/P/T-Relation  
- Reprinted without new art/flavor text since a while.

Posted By: Quentil (8/2/2012 7:06:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In all truth, I'd rather have a 3/4 than a 4/3.   
  
The reason for printing this makes sense: Black needs a common vanilla biggy, so here it is. In a draft, a Zombie Goliath may find itself to be more valuable than drawing a [Rise from the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rise from the Grave), depending on the situation.  
  
You all have to keep in mind that the ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) cost is very splashable, and creatures are highly necessary in Drafts. If you don't have creatures in a Draft, you are probably not going to do well.   
  
Regardless, it is very unsatisfying when this gets [Searing Spear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Searing Spear)'ed, and thus why I'd rather have a 3/4.
posts.html:
In all truth, I'd rather have a 3/4 than a 4/3.

The reason for printing this makes sense: Black needs a common vanilla biggy, so here it is. In a draft, a Zombie Goliath may find itself to be more valuable than drawing a Rise from the Grave, depending on the situation.

You all have to keep in mind that the cost is very splashable, and creatures are highly necessary in Drafts. If you don't have creatures in a Draft, you are probably not going to do well.

Regardless, it is very unsatisfying when this gets Searing Spear'ed, and thus why I'd rather have a 3/4.
